stadium.name: The Glowstone Terrace
stadium.description: A massive, opulent stadium built on one of the city's main terraces, carved directly into the mountainside. The field is famously paved with polished Glowstone, and the stands overlook the bustling Confluence Market and the ongoing construction of the Guild's Skyport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Doing a terrible, clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints'.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).

stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.

preGame:
Well, hello there, sports fans and blood-thirsty enthusiasts! It‚Äôs a glorious Tuesday night for some Trollball action, coming to you live from the shimmering heights of The Glowstone Terrace in the World's Spine Mountains! We‚Äôre kicking off the Losers Bracket in these high-stakes playoffs, and the atmosphere is absolutely electric‚Äîor maybe that‚Äôs just the Glowstone Glare burning my retinas! It's Game 1 of a Best of 3 series, meaning there's no room for error if these teams want to keep their championship dreams from tumbling down the mountainside! üèîÔ∏è‚ú®

Down on the field, the home-town Confluence Captains are looking more eccentric than a Guild meeting presided over by that cheese-obsessed Chairman Toland! I just saw Ladew Evelina chug a raw egg, shell and all‚Äînow that‚Äôs what I call a balanced breakfast for a beating! Meanwhile, Vonni Geoff is slathering his arms in sticky tree sap. It‚Äôs messy, it‚Äôs gross, and it‚Äôs exactly the kind of tactical advantage that makes me tingle in my demonic essence! The Captains have the crowd on their side today, but will the mountain wind blow their luck away? üå¨Ô∏èü•ö

But don't you dare count out the visitors! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have arrived, and they look ready to start a riot! Lian Denton is already nursing a dented tin cup of hot gravy, and I can hear Wolbrom Ariella singing a sea shanty so out of tune it might actually be a form of psychological warfare! These Creatures are associated with Dame Terra Monteforte, and you know she didn't raise any quitters‚Äîjust potential kidnappers! It‚Äôs the Guild of the Black Sky versus the White Ravens‚Äô finest brawlers. Grab your snacks and keep your eyes on the ball, because someone is going home in a bucket tonight! üèüÔ∏èüíÄ
postGame:
Can you believe it, folks? A real defensive masterpiece and a symphony of shattered ribs! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have come into the opulent backyard of the Guild and walked away with a 2-0 victory in Game 1! The Glowstone Terrace might be paved with polished rock, but today it was stained with the sweat and tears of the Confluence Captains! It was a playoff atmosphere that would make even Geth the Gravelord crack a smile! üëèü¶¥

The action started with a frantic scramble in Center Field, where Belding Chloe snatched up the Trollball like a bargain at the Confluence Market! But the Chaos Creatures weren't here to shop; they were here to maim! Gabriele Klehm laid into Richia Pazit with a tackle so fierce it sent the Captain straight to the healer‚Äôs tent! Not to be outdone, Wolbrom Ariella followed up by putting Carnahan Laud on the injury list. It was a beautiful display of carnage that had the rowdy crowd screaming for more! üî®üí•

Then came the play of the game, listeners! Raouf Dragone, that trident-wielding terror, found himself in Home Field with the eyes of a predator. He didn't bother running; he just launched that leather troll head with the precision of a master assassin! It sailed through the goal for a spectacular 2-point shoot! The Chaos Creatures took the lead and never looked back, silencing the Guild sycophants in the stands! üéØüî•

The Captains tried to fight back, and boy, did they get mean! O'Conner Maighdlin‚Äîwho I hear was rhyming his threats all morning‚Äîabsolutely leveled Fogel Raynold! Belding Chloe showed some fire too, taking out Urata Oriana and later Wolbrom Ariella. It was a back-and-forth of brutality that reminded me of my days in the Demon Prison, only with better lighting and fewer chains! ‚õìÔ∏èüëä

We saw a regular festival of interceptions today! Alben Diantha threw a wild one that Caves Cestar plucked out of the air, only for the Creatures to snatch it back later. It was like watching a group of drunken sailors trying to share a single bottle of rum! Speaking of which, the open bar seems to have hit the Captains hard‚ÄîDeach Sharlene and Behl Berstine were running around with their boots on the wrong feet! Talk about a lack of coordination! üçªü•¥

At halftime, the healers worked their magic, stitching up the wounded and tossing them back into the meat grinder. But the break didn't help the Captains' aim! Ladew Evelina and Deach Sharlene both had opportunities to put points on the board from the Away Field, but their shots went wider than Sir Garon Ironrock‚Äôs favorite door! You‚Äôd think with all that sticky sap on his arms, Vonni Geoff could hold onto the ball, but he dropped it in the 2-point zone like it was a hot coal! üëêüí®

Boulanger Procto, who spent his morning arranging his gear in perfect spirals, showed he can arrange an opponent's face just as neatly! He flattened Vonni Geoff early in the second half, ensuring the Captains stayed on their heels. The Chaos Creatures‚Äô defense was a wall of iron and bad intentions, frustrating every attempt the Guild's favorites made to cross the line! üõ°Ô∏èüöß

And what about the 'heroes' of the realm? I didn't see Sir Artorias or that warlock Morgwae coming to save the Captains today! I suppose they're too busy being 'noble' to enjoy a good old-fashioned skull-cracking. Nikos Thanae might be 'Benevolent,' but the only thing benevolent about the Captains today was how easily they gave up possession! Maybe they should spend less time on civic engagement and more time practicing their footwork! üïäÔ∏èüëé

As the final whistle blew, the Chaos Creatures held firm. Tucker Hett added one last exclamation point to the game by injuring Richia Pazit again! Talk about adding insult to injury! The Captains look shell-shocked, and the Confluence Market is going to be a very quiet place tonight while the Chaos Creatures celebrate with more hot gravy and off-key singing! üé∂ü•£

So, the series stands at 1-0 in favor of the New Monteforte Chaos Creatures! They‚Äôve taken the lead in this Losers Bracket battle, and the Confluence Captains are officially on the brink of elimination! Can the Guild‚Äôs golden boys bounce back, or will the Creatures finish the job in Game 2? Tune in next time, sports fans, for more bone-crunching, heart-stopping Trollball! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the mountains! Stay brutal, Osterra! üèîÔ∏èüèÜ
